MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.RemoteLoginSettings GetRemoteLoginSettings(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed
Public Function GetRemoteLoginSettings (Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = null) As RemoteLoginSettings

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Gets the settings required for remote login to a compute node.

remarks.para: This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

This method can be invoked only if the pool is created with a property. If this method is invoked on pools created with , then Batch service returns 409 (Conflict). For pools with a property, one of the GetRDPFileAsync/GetRDPFile methods must be used.

A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Gets the settings required for remote login to a compute node.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The get remote login settings operation runs asynchronously.

This method can be invoked only if the pool is created with a property. If this method is invoked on pools created with , then Batch service returns 409 (Conflict). For pools with a property, one of the GetRDPFileAsync/GetRDPFile methods must be used.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalTasksRun As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: property Nullable<int> TotalTasksRun { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of tasks that have been run on this compute node from the time it was allocated to this pool. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalTasksSucceeded As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: property Nullable<int> TotalTasksSucceeded { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of tasks which completed successfully (with exitCode 0) on the compute node. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Azure.Batch.UploadBatchServiceLogsResult UploadComputeNodeBatchServiceLogs (string containerUrl, DateTime startTime, Nullable<DateTime> endTime = null, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.UploadBatchServiceLogsResult UploadComputeNodeBatchServiceLogs(string containerUrl, valuetype System.DateTime startTime, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> endTime, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Public Function UploadComputeNodeBatchServiceLogs (containerUrl As String, startTime As DateTime, Optional endTime As Nullable(Of DateTime) = null, Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = null) As UploadBatchServiceLogsResult

Docs.param: The URL of the container within Azure Blob Storage to which to upload the Batch Service log file(s). The URL must include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting write permissions to the container.

The start of the time range from which to upload Batch Service log file(s). Any log file containing a log message in the time range will be uploaded. This means that the operation might retrieve more logs than have been requested since the entire log file is always uploaded.

The end of the time range from which to upload Batch Service log file(s). Any log file containing a log message in the time range will be uploaded. This means that the operation might retrieve more logs than have been requested since the entire log file is always uploaded. If this is omitted, the default is the current time.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Upload Azure Batch service log files from the specified compute node.
Docs.returns: The result of uploading the batch service logs.
Docs.remarks: This is for gathering Azure Batch service log files in an automated fashion from nodes if you are experiencing an error and wish to escalate to Azure support. The Azure Batch service log files should be shared with Azure support to aid in debugging issues with the Batch service.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.UploadBatchServiceLogsResult> UploadComputeNodeBatchServiceLogsAsync (string containerUrl, DateTime startTime, Nullable<DateTime> endTime = null, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.UploadBatchServiceLogsResult> UploadComputeNodeBatchServiceLogsAsync(string containerUrl, valuetype System.DateTime startTime, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> endTime, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL of the container within Azure Blob Storage to which to upload the Batch Service log file(s). The URL must include a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting write permissions to the container.

The start of the time range from which to upload Batch Service log file(s). Any log file containing a log message in the time range will be uploaded. This means that the operation might retrieve more logs than have been requested since the entire log file is always uploaded.

The end of the time range from which to upload Batch Service log file(s). Any log file containing a log message in the time range will be uploaded. This means that the operation might retrieve more logs than have been requested since the entire log file is always uploaded. If this is omitted, the default is the current time.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Upload Azure Batch service log files from the compute node.
Docs.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.
Docs.remarks: This is for gathering Azure Batch service log files in an automated fashion from nodes if you are experiencing an error and wish to escalate to Azure support. The Azure Batch service log files should be shared with Azure support to aid in debugging issues with the Batch service.
